page.title: 01Cladich & district, Argyll
page.content: Land use in this block is confined to a few dwelling houses, some afforestation, rough grazing, roads and open ground. The area is essentially isolated and whilst a main trunk road passes through the area few people spend time here. Highland cattle are the permanent residents of the area. The village of Cladich is near one of the main North/South drove routes and was at one time a busy junction. Today Cladich is used by occasional holiday visitors seeking almost total peace and quiet. The area is in general used for grazing cattle and sheep. However, plantations of trees for commercial use are gradually encroaching on the generally undeveloped landscape.
